trustfund:
TF030807-JAPAN CTF - FY06 GENERAL: GENERAL,TF057072-LIBERIA INFRASTRUCTURE
            REHABILITATION PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The project, development objective of
            the Liberian Infrastructure Rehabilitation Project (LIRP),
            is to provide Government with emergency support to restore
            priority infrastructure in the Port of Monrovia and at
            Roberts International Airport and assist the Government in
            developing a medium-term strategic framework for
            rehabilitating the port and aviation sectors. Successful
            implementation of the project will be evidenced by: (a)
            identified civil works implemented; (b) institutional
            capacity strengthened; and (c) Government has developed a
            strategic framework for port and aviation sector. There are
            three components to the project: (1) infrastructure
            rehabilitation in which the Technical Assessment Report o f
            Emergency and Longer Term Actions required in the Port of
            Monrovia lists some 25 different projects identified through
            detailed discussions and workshops with the National Port
            Authority (NPA) and stakeholders; (2) technical assistance
            and capacity building to provide selective and ad-hoc
            technical assistance to Government, including support to
            develop a strategic framework for the sub-sectors, as well
            as targeted training in NPA and Roberts International
            Airport (RIA) to complement normalization of operations; and
            (c) project management to implement overall responsibility
            by the Ministry o f Public Works through a Special
            Implementation Unit (SIU) being set up and which will
            provide coordination, procurement, M&E and support to
            safeguard management.
